q: Describe what you did.
a: Over the past months, I performed various activities at 5 different days, including introducing myself, grasping the milk, receiving and handing over objects, loading the dishwasher, and engaging in dialog with the user.

q: Tell me in detail what happened yesterday before noon.
a: I first grasped the milk, moved backwards, and went to home pose. Then I introduced myself, moved further back, went to home pose, looked ahead, navigated to home position, failed to grasp the 'object' object, and tried to receive an object from the human. Later, I looked ahead and down, closed and opened my hand, again looked ahead, down and ahead, and performed another introduction.

q: Explain briefly what you did at each day that you can remember.
a: On June 26, I handed over and received objects multiple times, learned a new object, and engaged in dialog. On June 27, I navigated to multiple locations, introduced myself, and grasped the milk. On July 12, I described my surroundings, went to home pose, brought the milk, received and handed over objects, loaded the dishwasher, failed to learn a person, and introduced myself. On July 13, I performed introductions, navigated to various locations, handed over objects, loaded a dishwasher, analyzed surroundings, and performed grasping tasks. On August 27, I introduced myself, engaged in conversations, moved around, shaped my hands, and handled objects, with mixed success.

q: Summarize your highlights from June.
a: On June 26 and 27, among other activities, I handed over and received objects, introduced myself, and learned a new object.

q: Explain in detail what you did when you introduce yourself.
a: I start by waving and introducing myself verbally. I then continue by explaining my purpose and my hardware design while moving my joints. Afterwards, I tell about my software abilities, point with my hand, and showcase my workspace with my arms. After returning to home pose, I talk about my hands. In the end, I move around and rotate my platform to explain its capabilities, and finally offer my help to the user.

a: Initially, the speech recognition was off, and I tried to grasp the 'Moog' which does not exist. The user had to repeat the command.
